PERFECT project for branching from making Emulators to making programming languages. Cool way to explore making that with a super simple language designed around hardware i have designed myself.

Currently i dont actually use micro codes. I hardcode the functionality of the microcodes in each clock step of an instruction.

Both for a more accurate simulation AND much cleaner code.. Refactor so that you actualy use microcodes. Make each microcode (I.e AO = Output A Register to Bus) work like it should and then just call the required microcodes at the correct steps.

This is more accurate to hardware.
